ApplicableDirections.description: This is used to know the direction of application of certain objects
ApplicableDirections.title: ApplicableDirections

ApplicableDirectionsTrackRange.description: An applicable directions track range is a track range with associated directions.

applicable_directions.description: Direction where the corresponding object is applied

begin.description: Begin offset in meters of the corresponding track section
begin.title: Begin

end.description: End offset in meters of the corresponding track section
end.title: End

conditional_parameters.title: Conditional Parameters

next_signaling_systems.description: The list of allowed input signaling systems

conditional_parameters.title: Conditional Parameters

next_signaling_systems.description: The list of allowed input signaling systems

BufferStop.description:
This class defines the buffer stop object.
A buffer stop is a device placed at the end of a dead-end road
to stop any drifting trains from continuing off the road.
A buffer stop is characterized by its id and its corresponding track.

position.description: Offset of the point in meters to the beginning of the track section
position.title: Position

track.description: Reference to the track section on which the object is located
track.title: Track

BufferStop.title: BufferStop

kp.description: Kilometric point of the buffer stop
kp.title: Kp

on_route.description: Route on which the parameters are applied
on_route.title: On Route

parameters.description: List of key value parameters, which are defined per signaling system
parameters.title: Parameters

Curve.description:
This class is used to define the curve object.
A curve correspond at radius of curvature in the part of corresponding track section.

begin.description: Offset in meters corresponding at the beginning of the corresponding radius in a track section
begin.title: Begin

end.description: Offset in meters corresponding at the end of the corresponding radius in a track section
end.title: End

radius.description: Corresponding radius of curvature measured in meters
radius.title: Radius

Curve.title: Curve

Detector.description:
This class defines detector object.
A detector is characterized by its id and its corresponding track.
A detector is used to locate a train
in order to consider the section as occupied when there is a train.

position.description: Offset of the point in meters to the beginning of the track section
position.title: Position

track.description: Reference to the track section on which the object is located
track.title: Track

Detector.title: Detector

Direction.description: This is the description of the direction (increasing or decreasing profile).
Direction.title: Direction

DirectionalTrackRange.description: A directional track range is a track range with an associated direction.

begin.description: Begin offset in meters of the corresponding track section
begin.title: Begin

end.description: End offset in meters of the corresponding track section
end.title: End

DirectionalTrackRange.title: DirectionalTrackRange

Electrification.description:
An electrification corresponds to a set of cables designed to power
electric trains by capturing the current through the use
of a pantograph. Electrification is identified by its identifier.

track_ranges.description: List of locations where the voltage is applied
track_ranges.title: Track Ranges

voltage.description: Type of power supply (in Volts) used for electrification
voltage.title: Voltage

Electrification.title: Electrification

LimitedLogicalSignal.description: Limited list of logical signals. Used to generate a usable schema for the front editor
LimitedLogicalSignal.title: LimitedLogicalSignal

LoadingGaugeLimit.description:
This class is used to define loading gauge limit.
It represents a restriction on the trains according to their categories of loading gauge
and the type of the corresponding rolling stock.

begin.description: Offset in meters corresponding at the beginning of the corresponding loading gauge limit
begin.title: Begin

category.description: Category of loading gauge for the corresponding rolling stock

end.description: Offset in meters corresponding at the end of the corresponding loading gauge limit
end.title: End

LoadingGaugeLimit.title: LoadingGaugeLimit

LoadingGaugeType.description: This class allows to know the category of the loading gauge.
LoadingGaugeType.title: LoadingGaugeType

LogicalSignal.description: A logical signal is what displays something, whereas a physical signal is a group of logical signals

conditional_parameters.description: A list of conditional parameters, which are defined per signaling system
conditional_parameters.title: Conditional Parameters

default_parameters.description: A list of default parameters (in regards to routes), which are defined per signaling system
default_parameters.title: Default Parameters

next_signaling_systems.description: The list of allowed input signaling systems
next_signaling_systems.title: Next Signaling Systems

settings.description: A list of key value parameters, which are defined per signaling system
settings.title: Settings

LogicalSignal.title: LogicalSignal

NeutralSection.description:
Neutral sections are portions of track where trains aren't allowed to pull power from electrifications.
They have to rely on inertia to cross such sections.

In practice, neutral sections are delimited by signs. In OSRD, neutral sections are directional
to allow accounting for different sign placement depending on the direction.

For more details see [the documentation](https://osrd.fr/en/docs/explanation/neutral_sections/).

announcement_track_ranges.description: List of locations where the upcoming neutral section is announced but not yet crossed
announcement_track_ranges.title: Announcement Track Ranges

lower_pantograph.description: Whether or not trains need to lower their pantograph in the section
lower_pantograph.title: Lower Pantograph

track_ranges.description: List of locations where the train cannot pull power from electrifications
track_ranges.title: Track Ranges

NeutralSection.title: NeutralSection

announcement.description: Precise that there is bp/cc neutral section
announcement.title: Announcement

end.description: End of the bp/cc neutral section
end.title: End

exe.description: Beginning of the bp/cc neutral section

rev.description: REV of the bp/cc neutral section
rev.title: Rev

OperationalPoint.description: This class describes the operational points of the corresponding infra.
OperationalPoint.title: OperationalPoint

uic.description: International Union of Railways code of the operational point
uic.title: Uic

OperationalPointPart.description: Operational point part is a single point on the infrastructure. It's linked to an operational point.

position.description: Offset of the point in meters to the beginning of the track section
position.title: Position

track.description: Reference to the track section on which the object is located
track.title: Track

kp.title: Kp

ch.description: THOR site code of the operational point

ch_long_label.description: THOR site code long label of the operational point

ch_short_label.description: THOR site code short label of the operational point
ch_short_label.title: Ch Short Label

ci.description: THOR immutable code of the operational point
ci.title: Ci

trigram.description: Unique SNCF trigram of the operational point
trigram.title: Trigram

Route.description: This class is used to describe routes on the infrastructure.

entry_point_direction.description: Direction of the route at the entry point

release_detectors.description: Detector allowing the release of resources reserved from the beginning of the route until this one
release_detectors.title: Release Detectors

track_nodes_directions.description: TrackNodes position part of the route
track_nodes_directions.title: TrackNodes Directions

Route.title: Route

Side.description: This class describes the side of the track where the signal is located.
Side.title: Side

Sign.description:
This class is used to define signs.
This is a physical, punctual, cosmetic object.

direction.description: Direction of the sign on the track

position.description: Offset of the point in meters to the beginning of the track section
position.title: Position

side.description: Side of the sign on the track

track.description: Reference to the track section on which the object is located
track.title: Track

type.description: Precise the type of the sign
type.title: Type

value.description: If the sign is an announcement, precise the value(s)
value.title: Value

Sign.title: Sign

Signal.description:
This class is used to describe the signal.
A signal is characterized by its id and its corresponding track.
By default, the signal is located at the center of the track.

direction.description: Direction of use of the signal

logical_signals.description: Logical signals bundled into this physical signal
logical_signals.title: Logical Signals

position.description: Offset of the point in meters to the beginning of the track section
position.title: Position

sight_distance.description: Visibility distance of the signal in meters
sight_distance.title: Sight Distance

track.description: Reference to the track section on which the object is located
track.title: Track

Signal.title: Signal

side.description: Side of the signal on the track

Slope.description:
This class is used to define the slope object.
A slope correspond at the gradient in the part of corresponding track section.
The gradient can be positive (case of ramp) or negative (slope case)

begin.description: Offset in meters corresponding at the beginning of the corresponding gradient in a track section
begin.title: Begin

end.description: Offset in meters corresponding at the end of the corresponding gradient in a track section
end.title: End

gradient.description: Corresponding gradient, measured in meters per kilometers
gradient.title: Gradient

Slope.title: Slope

SpeedSection.description: Speed sections are recognized by their identifiers and are in meters per second.

on_routes.description:
A list of routes the speed limit is enforced on.
When empty or None, the speed limit is enforced regardless of the route.
on_routes.title: On Routes

speed_limit.description: Speed limit (m/s) applied by default to trains that aren't in any specified category
speed_limit.title: Speed Limit

speed_limit_by_tag.description: Speed limit (m/s) applied to trains with a given tag
speed_limit_by_tag.title: Speed Limit By Tag

track_ranges.description: List of locations where speed section is applied
track_ranges.title: Track Ranges

SpeedSection.title: SpeedSection

announcement.description: Precise the value(s) of the speed
announcement.title: Announcement

r.description: End of the psl speed section
r.title: R

z.description: Beginning of the psl speed section

Switch.description: TrackNodes are devices used for track changes.

group_change_delay.description: Time it takes to change which group of the switch is activated
group_change_delay.title: Group Change Delay

ports.description: Location of different ports according to track sections
ports.title: Ports

track_node_type.description: Identifier and type of the switch type
track_node_type.title: Switch Type

Switch.title: Switch

SwitchPortConnection.description:
This class allows to know the connection between each port in switch type.
The connection is always bidirectional.

dst.description: Port name that is destination of the connection
dst.title: Dst

src.description: Port name that is source of the connection
src.title: Src

SwitchPortConnection.title: SwitchPortConnection

TrackNodeType.description:
Switch types are used to define what kind of switch is used in the infrastructure.
A switch type is defined by a list of ports and groups which are the possible configurations of the switch.

ports.description: List of ports. Ports map to the ends of track_nodes
ports.title: Ports

TrackNodeType.title: TrackNodeType

TrackEndpoint.description: This class is used to define the endpoint (begin or end) of the considered track on the infrastructure.

endpoint.description: Relative position of the considered end point

track.description: Identifier and type of the track
track.title: Track

TrackEndpoint.title: TrackEndpoint

TrackSection.description:
A track section is a piece of track and is the tracking system used in OSRD to locate a point.
A track section is identified by his unique id and its coordinates (geographic).

curves.description: List of curves of corresponding track section
curves.title: Curves

geo.description: Geographic coordinates of the corresponding object

length.description: Value of the length of the track section in meters
length.title: Length

loading_gauge_limits.description: List of loading gauge limits of corresponding track section
loading_gauge_limits.title: Loading Gauge Limits

slopes.description: List of slopes of corresponding track section
slopes.title: Slopes

TrackSection.title: TrackSection

line_name.description: Name of the line used by the corresponding track section

track_name.description: Name corresponding to the track used

track_number.description: Number corresponding to the track used
track_number.title: Track Number

id.description: ID used for the line in the source
id.title: Id
